Description: Unhealthy: Non-native crayfish populations have increased and compete with native species for resources

Description: Healthy: Sandy nearshore habitat is found in some regions around the lake

Description: It Depends: Algae can be a natural part of the ecosystem, but excessive algae can be an indicator of nutrient pollution into the water
Source link 1 - Image File Name: TERC_Brant Allen Sampling Periphyton at Pineland.jpg

Description: It Depends: Algae can be a natural part of the ecosystem, but excessive algae can be an indicator of nutrient pollution into the water

SUBJECT OF PICTURE: Invasive clam shells under the water
Description: Unhealthy: Non-native Asian clams are increasing in population, spreading to other areas around the lake, and resulting in unsightly and unhealthy algal blooms
Healthy: In some parts of the lake the bottom is rocky

SUBJECT OF PICTURE: Sediment at bottom of the lake
Description: Healthy: In the deeper portions of the lake the bottom is mostly sediment that has been accumulating since the lake was first formed

SUBJECT OF PICTURE: Boat wreck at bottom of the lake
Description: It Depends: Boat wrecks can provide habitat for fish and other species However, pollutants such as gasoline, can leach into the water as materials on the boat begin to break down
Healthy: In some areas, decomposed granite (granite rock broken down for construction purposes) is found on the lake bottom
Healthy: Small "bugs" found in the sediment are an important part of the food web
It Depends: Mysis shrimp are non-native and have eaten many of the native zooplankton in Lake Tahoe
Rubber mats have been put on the bottom of the lake to manage the non-native Asian clam populations
Unhealthy: Old tires are found at the bottom of the lake and should be removed because the tires can break down into chemicals which can harm the plants and animals in the lake
It Depends: Some aquatic plants are native and some are non-native and/or invasive
Healthy: Fish build nests on the lake bottom
Healthy: Sonar technologies bounce sound off the bottom of the lake to map the lake's bathymetry or bottom topography
Unhealthy: Trash found at the bottom of the lake
Unhealthy: Algae blooms can harm fish in the lake by using up the oxygen during decomposition
Unhealthy: Invasive water plants can choke out native vegetation and multiply quickly
It Depends: Some aquatic plants are native and some are non-native and/or invasive

It Depends: While ducks are native to the environment, more ducks mean more duck droppings Excess feces cause water pollution, create an unsanitary environment for human recreation, and lead to the spread of disease in the bird population

Unhealthy: Eurasian watermilfoil is a non-native, invasive aquatic plant that can quickly spread It has been known to crowd out native plants and create dense mats that interfere with recreational activity
It Depends: Piers can damage the shorezone area of a lake, but they can also provide valuable habitat for fish
Healthy: Human-powered sports generally have less impact, however, kayakers must be certain that they do not transport non-native invaders from other waterbodies
Healthy: Human-powered sports generally have less impact, however, paddleboarders must be certain that they do not transport non-native invaders from other waterbodies
It Depends: Waves from motor boats can cause shoreline erosion
Healthy: Minnows are found in the nearshore around rocks and under piers
Unhealthy: Even non-motorized watercraft can transport invasive species into a lake
It Depends: Before launching your boat, always have it inspected to prevent the spread of aquatic invasive species
Healthy: Mandatory boat inspections help prevent the spread of invasive species that can have devastating long-term effects on Lake Tahoe and its streams
Healthy: Fly fishing usually has minimal impact, but invasive species can also be transported by fishing gear, bait buckets, live bait wells

Description: Healthy: Quagga mussel shells are sharpâ€¦you don't want them on your beaches
Unhealthy: Quagga mussel shells are sharpâ€¦you don't want them on your beaches

Healthy: Human-powered sports generally have less impact, however, kayakers must be certain that they do not transport non-native invaders from other waterbodies or impact the organisms living in the lake they're kayaking in(?)
Healthy: Human-powered sports generally have less impact, however, paddleboarders must be certain that they do not transport non-native invaders from other waterbodies
It Depends: Only 4-stroke engines are allowed in Lake Tahoe to reduce the amount of toxic gas and oil that can get into the lake
Unhealthy: Oil can be toxic to plants and animals in the water
Unhealthy: Plastic can be harmful to fish, birds and other animals and should be removed
Unhealthy: Plastic can be harmful to fish, birds and other animals and should be removed
Healthy: What gets measured gets done right Scientific research allows for wise public policy decisions
It Depends: Lake trout were intentionally introduced into Lake Tahoe in the 1800s and outcompeted the native Lahontan cutthroat trout

SUBJECT OF PICTURE: Other fish that live in pelagic zone
Description: It Depends: Native or non-native? The fish might be essential part of the natural food web or they may be out competing native species for resources
Healthy: Essential to any lake food web Tiny organisms that feed off phytoplankton keeping the waters clear Food for fish
Healthy: Harnesses renewable wind energy while producing only minimal water and air pollution
Healthy: Water with minimal algae and sediment is clear and this type of water is considered oligotrophic, meaning it is low in plant nutrients and has lots of oxygen available
Unhealthy: Large algal blooms deplete oxygen from the water and block sunlight
Anything else/Comments: But since some lakes are naturally eutrophic so how / will we address that?

Description: It Depends: Some ferries are a form of mass transportation which reduces the carbon footprint compared with everyone driving individually Older ferries still discharge coal-ash mixture directly into the water body
Healthy: Bright green pine pollen can be seen floating on the surface of the lake in spring This is often confused with algal blooms or pollution but it is natural and safe for the lake
Healthy: Most lakes either partially or completely mix from top to bottom This process brings oxygen from the surface down into the deeper waters of the lake
It Depends: Many lakes have a mythological creature, such as Tahoe Tessie, Champ, or Loch Ness Monster, which is thought to live in the deep waters
It Depends: Various climate factors such as wind, humidity, and temperature can impact the rate of evaporation (or changing of water to water vapor) from the surface of the lake
Healthy: Researchers study the underwater ecosystem of Lake Tahoe
Unhealthy: Oil from from leaking boats is toxic to plants and animals in the water

It Depends: Precipitation is a natural part of the hydrologic cycle and replenishes the water supply However, snow is usually never pure water and any particulate matter/pollution in the airshed will be carried by the snow into the water

SUBJECT OF PICTURE: Research vessel with secchi disk measurement underway
Description: Healthy: What gets measured gets done right Scientific research allows for wise public policy decisions
Unhealthy: Off-highway vehicles (OHV) can cause soil compaction and erosion, harm vegetation and water quality, and threaten both plant and animal habitat
It Depends: Too much fertilizer can run off into streams and lakes and cause algae to bloom

Unhealthy: Runaway wildfires tend to burn hot, resulting in a lot of smoke and ash, and when large areas are burned can result in erosion when rainstorms wash the unprotected soil into streams or lakes
It Depends: Prescribed or controlled burns reduce the risk of wildfires and if properly managed can reduce impact of fires
Source link 1 - Image File Name: requested images from "Living with Fire" Cooperative Extension

Description: Unhealthy: Never plant non-native invasive ornamental weeds on your property
Unhealthy: Geese eat grass and poop nutrients that can wash into the lake and cause algal blooms

Unhealthy: Pet waste contains harmful bacteria and nutrients that can cause algal blooms if washed into the water However, if you pick up pet waste you can keep it out of our drinking water supply and prevent it from affecting lake health

SUBJECT OF PICTURE: Eurasian watermilfoil on pulled out of the water
Description: Unhealthy: This invasive plant can get caught on boat propellers and be transported into other waterbodies, where it can negatively affect the aquatic ecosystem
Image source (e.g., TERC-owned or source: The League to Save Lake Tahoe

Description: It Depends: Human-powered sports generally have less impact to the land, however, mountain bikers should stay on trail and stay out of sensitive lands

It Depends: Golf courses require a large amount of fertilizer to maintain the expansive green grass areas, however, if managed properly, the impacts to water quality from the nutrient-rich fertilizer can be kept to a minimum
Healthy: Human-powered sports generally have less impact to the land, however, hikers should stay on trail and stay out of sensitive lands

SUBJECT OF PICTURE: Jeep tears rutts in a meadow
Description: Unhealthy: Vehicles driving through sensitive lands such as meadows can severely impact the land for years to come
Image source (e.g., TERC-owned or source: Credit: Laura Clarke, U.S. Forest Service, Tahoe National Forest
Anything else/Comments: Is this represented by 'Off-road vehicles'? Necessary to have as a separate entry?

Description: Unhealthy: Oil from the land can end up in the lake and be toxic to plants and animals in the water
Unhealthy: Plastic can be harmful to fish, birds and other animals and should be removed
It Depends: Farm lands can require a large amount of fertilizer, however, if managed properly, the impacts to water quality from the nutrient-rich fertilizer can be kept to a minimum
Unhealthy: Cows grazing can cause erosion and cow poop can pollute the lake
Unhealthy: Quagga mussels are aquatic invasive species that would have devastating long-term effects on Lake Tahoe and its streams and must be kept out of Lake Tahoe
Unhealthy: Erosion brings sediment (fine particles) which can cloud the waters and reduce lake clarity
It Depends: Paving roads reduces available land for water to soak in but is better than dirt roads
It Depends: Construction activities can harm the lake, but properly installed and maintained BMPs can reduce the impact
Anything else/Comments: Couldn't construction anywhere in the watershed affect the lake, e.g., through erosion, waste runoff, etc. I guess I wasn't sure what the 'water's edge' focus is meant to convey.

Description: Healthy: Tahoe basin property owners must ensure there is defensible space at their home to help minimize the risk of fire hazards that can affect lake health.
Unhealthy: Driving on dirt compacts the soil, prevents plants from growing, and contributes to erosion and polluted run-off
Healthy: Ride a bike, take public transportation, walk or carpool to reduce the number of vehicles on local roads
Anything else/Comments: Is it possible to highlight climate change in some of these entries (e.g., the ones related to driving too)? Seems like a key topic to address.

Description: Unhealthy: Excessive automobile use degrades air quality and contributes to the decline in Tahoe's clarity; In addition, excessive automobile use contributes to climate change which threatens the health of the entire lake ecosystem
Healthy: Open fireplaces and inefficient wood stoves contribute to poor air qualityâ€¦ replace with a clean-burning, high-efficient wood stove options
Unhealthy: Open fireplaces and inefficient wood stoves contribute to poor air qualityâ€¦ replace with a clean-burning, high-efficient wood stove options

Healthy: Sweep instead of using leaf blowers Leaf blowers move the fine particles into the air, reducing air quality and visibility, and sending the fine particles into the lake, causing reduced water clarity

Unhealthy: Sweep instead of using leaf blowers Leaf blowers move the fine particles into the air, reducing air quality and visibility, and sending the fine particles into the lake, causing reduced water clarity
Unhealthy: Invasive species can also be transported by fishing gear, bait buckets, live bait wells
Healthy: Buy a fire permit, use established fire pits, know fire restrictions, have fire pan/shovel/hose nearby
It Depends: Boat wrecks can provide habitat for fish and other species However, pollutants such as gasoline, can leach into the water as materials on the boat begin to break down

Description: Healthy: Tahoe homeowners have to "get defensive" with defensible space to help increase the chance the home can be saved if there is a wildfire

SUBJECT OF PICTURE: Forest fire destroying home without defensible space
Description: Unhealthy: Homes without defensible space cannot be safely protected by fire crews during a wildfire
Image source (e.g., TERC-owned or source: The League to Save Lake Tahoe

SUBJECT OF PICTURE: Healthy trees spaced widely in forest
Description: Healthy: In 'natural' forests, trees tend to be spaced out due to resource competition; Wider spacing spreads out the fuel load and slows down the spread of fires
Unhealthy: Overcrowded forests increase fuel loads and enhance the speed at which fire spreads

Healthy: Show off your love and support of protecting Lake Tahoe by ordering or renewing your California or Nevada Lake Tahoe License Plate Nevada and California Lake Tahoe license plate funds benefit conservation and recreation projects in the basin
Source link 1 - Image File Name: Request sent to the Tahoe Fund

SUBJECT OF PICTURE: Big grass lawn, sprinkler, or dirt eroding
Description: Unhealthy: Start in your own backyard with a lake-friendly landscape to keep Tahoe blue

It Depends: Large lawns require a lot of fertilizer and water to maintain and can result in nutrient pollution into the lake, however, small properly managed lawn areas can also provide fire-safe defensible space areas around a home
Healthy: Native plants require less fertilizer and water and can provide better habitat for the native butterflies, bees and birds
Healthy: Start in your own backyard with a lake-friendly landscape to keep Tahoe blue

Healthy: Tahoe basin property owners have a special responsibility to implement BMPs on their property that infiltrate all water and keep eroding soil from leaving the property BMPs improve water quality by reducing soil erosion and capturing polluted water before it enters Lake Tahoe The intent of BMPs are to help designed landscapes better mimic the natural ecosystem, reducing the amount of dirt and sediment the flows into Tahoe Typical BMPs include armored drip line under roof eaves, slotted channel drains in driveways, slope stabilization, and infiltration basins

SUBJECT OF PICTURE: House not implementing BMPs (e.g., eroding dirt)
Description: Unhealthy: Tahoe basin property owners have a special responsibility to implement BMPs on their property that infiltrate all water and keep eroding soil from leaving the property BMPs improve water quality by reducing soil erosion and capturing polluted water before it enters Lake Tahoe The intent of BMPs are to help designed landscapes better mimic the natural ecosystem, reducing the amount of dirt and sediment the flows into Tahoe Typical BMPs include armored drip line under roof eaves, slotted channel drains in driveways, slope stabilization, and infiltration basins
Healthy: Clean communities are healthy environments

SUBJECT OF PICTURE: Trash community with plastic bags, styrofoam, cigarette butts, gang tagging
Description: Unhealthy: Trash negatively impacts the health and beauty of communities Plastic bags and cigarette butts harm wildlife and take a long time to degrade / break down in the ecosystem
